intro: Ceropegia campanulata var. porphyrotricha, commonly known as the purple-veined ceropegia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and tuberous roots. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires bright, indirect light for optimal growth. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated as a houseplant or in hanging baskets.
